page.title: 01Beckington.
page.content: Beckington is an historic village situated on the main road in a rural area three miles from Frome. It still maintains a community spirit and village atmosphere with the Village Hall, church and school playing an important part in village life. Beckington grew up and prospered because of its position on one of the early main roads which ran from London to Southampton and on to Bristol. When the New World was opened up this road became particularly important. Beckington flourished. Later wealthy wool merchants found Beckington ideally situated for their trade. Now Frome is the market town and Beckington has become a village. Three main roads now run through the village and the volume, size and speed of modern traffic makes living in the village difficult.
